myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cont_function, function, Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Chen Ostrovski 316402650, Ester Reznikov 315674028

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polynom()
      Zero Constructor : builds a new empty Polynom
      Polynom(Polynom other)
      Copy Constructor : deep copy, builds a new Polynom
      Polynom(java.lang.String polynom)
      String Constructor : builds a new Polynom, Get String as input and change it to Polynom

      Compute a value of x (x bigger or equal to x0 and x smaller or equal to x1, for f(x) smaller than eps), assuming that(f(x0)*f(x1)) smaller or equal to 0, returns f(x2) such that: (i) x0 bigger or equal to x1 bigger or equal to x2 and (ii) f(x2) smaller than eps

      • Polynom

        public Polynom(Polynom other)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Copy Constructor : deep copy, builds a new Polynom
        Parameters:
        other - get the Monoms from other Polynom and them in this Polynom
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if one of the Monoms in the Polynom have power the lower than zero

      • Polynom

        public Polynom(java.lang.String polynom)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        String Constructor : builds a new Polynom, Get String as input and change it to Polynom
        Parameters:
        polynom - proper input f(x) = a_1x^b_1 + a_2*x^b_2 ... a_n*xb_n
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the Polynom equals to null
        java.lang.Exception - if the Polynom contains invalid signs

      • add

        public void add(Polynom_able p1)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method add other Polynom to this Polynom. Does not contain two Monoms with the same power, If the Monom equal to 0 don't add it
        Specified by:
        add in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        p1 - all the Monoms in other Polynom
        Throws:

      • add

        public void add(Monom m1)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method add Monom to this Polynom. Add two Monoms with the same power in order to avoid duplication, If the Monom equal to 0 don't add it
        Specified by:
        add in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        m1 - the Monom's coefficient and power
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the Monom have power that lower than zero

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute a value of x (x bigger or equal to x0 and x smaller or equal to x1, for f(x) smaller than eps), assuming that(f(x0)*f(x1)) smaller or equal to 0, returns f(x2) such that: (i) x0 bigger or equal to x1 bigger or equal to x2 and (ii) f(x2) smaller than eps
        Specified by:
        root in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point of the range
        x1 - ending point point of the range
        eps - step (positive) value
        Returns:
        mid
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if epsilon is negative number
        java.lang.Exception - if the range is invalid

      • area

        public double area(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute Riemann's Integral over this Polynom starting from x0, till x1 using eps size steps, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral
        Specified by:
        area in interface cont_function
        Specified by:
        area in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point of the range
        x1 - ending point point of the range
        eps - positive step value
        Returns:
        the approximated area above the x-axis below this Polynom and between the [x0,x1] range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if epsilon is negative number
        java.lang.Exception - if the range is invalid
        java.lang.Exception - if there is no cutting point with the X-axis

      • underArea

        public double underArea(double x0,
                        double x1,
                        double eps)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Auxiliary function the calculates the area if its under the X-axis
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point of the range
        x1 - ending point point of the range
        Returns:
        the approximated area under the x-axis above this Polynom and between the [x0,x1] range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is no cutting point with the X-axis

      • aboveArea

        public double aboveArea(double x0,
                        double x1,
                        double eps)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Auxiliary function the calculates the area if its above the X-axis
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point of the range
        x1 - ending point point of the range
        eps - the size of steps
        Returns:
        the approximated area above the x-axis under this Polynom and between the [x0,x1] range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is no cutting point with the X-axis

      • toPlot

        public void toPlot(double x1,
                   double x2)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used for build a new plot. Given a Polynom and range the method draws a new plot
        Parameters:
        x1 - the starting point of the range
        x2 - the ending point of the range
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the user build a invalid Polynom
        java.lang.Exception - if x1 is bigger than x2 (invalid range)
